metadata.title: CVE-2014-3494 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
kio/usernotificationhandler.cpp in the POP3 kioslave in kdelibs 4.10.95before 4.13.3 does not properly generate warning notifications, whichallows man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain sensitive information via aninvalid certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kdelibs-bin - 4:4.13.1-0ubuntu0.2
kdelibs5-data - 4:4.13.1-0ubuntu0.2
kdelibs5-plugins - 4:4.13.1-0ubuntu0.2
kdoctools - 4:4.13.1-0ubuntu0.2
libkcmutils4 - 4:4.13.1-0ubuntu0.2

criterions.comment: kde4libs package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:4.13.1-0ubuntu0.2').
